title: Fort Donelson National Battlefield: Stop 3 Log Huts
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Virtual Tour     Stop 3 Log Huts                Log Huts         Log Hut James P. Bagsby  Soldiers and slaves built more than 400 log huts for winter quarters. For the garrisoned soldiers working on the fort, time passed pleasantly enough. "We lived luxuriously in comfortable tents and log huts," stated one soldier. In addition to the government rations of flour, fresh and cured meats, sugar, and coffee, boats brought boxes from home.  Â      Inside View Log Hut James P. Bagsby  Off-duty soldiers from the local area hunted and fished in the same locations they frequented not six months before as civilians. Sometime after the surrender, Federals burned the huts because of a measles outbreak.
